ground_truth: The gantry turns, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower, as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons, and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi, driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines. He moves down plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The framework rotates, shifting Bond away from the firearm and drawing Mitchell from the platform. The renegade operative lands on a framework tower, as Bond tugs at the cord around his limb. He ascends for a firearm on the platform while Bond attempts to attain the one on the terrain. Both seize the armaments, and Bond discharges. The throngs are scattering in the Town Square as a patrol vehicle progresses down a congested avenue. Enveloped in dust, Bond strides through the throngs toward the wooden portal in the passage. Crimson blemishes the basement floor, but the captive, Mr. White, is absent. Bond gazes impassively at the tableau. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a skyscraper block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass portal. Ignoring a solid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The expert opens a portal for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing spectacles in the back of a cab, traversing a dusty avenue. He exits the cab opposite the weathered sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the dull-tiled lobby, strung with washing cords. He moves down bare concrete corridors, arrives at a portal, and positions himself to one flank of it. He uses an implement to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the portal into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the portal behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through glass portals, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the handset. He goes down and finds a pair of shears. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a volume. He parries the knife strikes and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the shears into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the portal keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a stern demeanor.

The manâ€™s eyes roll in agony, then he dies, the blood pools beneath his head, while Bond is left completely unmoved. The rooms are searched by him, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. A shirt is shrugged on, and the blood is wiped from his nose. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The gantry turns, moving Bond from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond reaches for one on the ground. Both grab their weapons, and Bond fires. Crowds disperse in the Town Square as a police car navigates a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowd toward the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but Mr. White, the prisoner, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise. M looks out from a balcony. Bond exits the Range Rover and enters the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond, now wearing shades, is in the back of a taxi on a dusty street. He exits opposite the faded sign of Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building, moving through the drab-tiled lobby with washing lines. He navigates plain corridors, arrives at a door, and picks the lock. Entering cautiously, he peers into the empty living room. Closing the door, he walks in when a switchblade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone. He finds scissors, slams the man into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book. He parries knife blows and grabs the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window onto a balcony. Bond grips his throat and drives scissors into his neck and thigh. Unmoved, Bond watches as the man dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He searches the rooms, takes a shirt from a wardrobe, and makes a bandage for his arm. He puts on a shirt, wipes blood from his nose, barely glances at the body, grabs the door keys, and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The gantry moves Bond from the gun, pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls the rope around his leg. Both grab guns, and Bond fires. Crowds disperse in the Town Square as a police car navigates a crowded street. Dust-covered, Bond strides through the crowd to the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but Mr. White is gone. Bond stares dispassionately. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise. M looks out from a balcony. Bond exits the Range Rover, enters the building, and joins M on the balcony, passing masked forensics officers. Bond, now wearing shades, rides in a taxi to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo and light trousers, he enters the drab-tiled lobby, moves through concrete corridors, and picks a lock to enter a plain living room. A man with a switchblade attacks. Bond slams him through glass into a bedroom. The man recovers, but Bond attacks with a phone, then a book, and parries knife blows. They go through a window onto a balcony. Bond drives scissors into the man's neck and thigh, killing him. Unmoved, Bond searches the rooms, makes a bandage for his arm, and wipes blood from his nose. He grabs door keys and heads downstairs, turning to the young woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The gantry slowly and deliberately turns, gradually moving Bond away from the gun and simultaneously pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent, with a sudden jolt, lands precariously on a scaffold tower, while Bond, with determination, pulls at the rope tightly wound around his leg. He begins to climb, reaching for a gun positioned on the scaffold, as Bond simultaneously tries to reach the one lying on the ground. Both men manage to scoop up their respective weapons, and Bond fires with precision. Meanwhile, the crowds are rapidly dispersing in the bustling Town Square as a police car carefully makes its way down the crowded street. Covered in a layer of dust, Bond strides purposefully through the throngs of people towards the wooden gate leading into the tunnel. Blood stains are visible on the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is nowhere to be found. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene, his expression unreadable. It's raining steadily when a sleek black Range Rover arrives at a towering high-rise block of flats. M stands pensively, looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard who stands watch, Bond enters a flat, passing by masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M, allowing her to enter. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades while seated in the back of a taxi, which is driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Dressed in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, which is strung with washing lines. He moves down the plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself strategically to one side of it. Using a tool, he carefully picks the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door quietly behind him, he walks further into the apartment when suddenly a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly and with intent. Bond reacts swiftly, slamming him through the glass into the bedroom. The man quickly recovers and swings again, but Bond counters with the phone. The man goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then retaliates by hitting him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and, with calculated force, drives the scissors into the man's neck and thigh. Bond remains completely unmoved as the man rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He proceeds to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on the shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim and determined demeanor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The towering gantry structure moves with an almost methodical slowness, deliberately rotating and gently relocating Bond further away from the gun while simultaneously and steadily pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. Suddenly, with a jarring jolt, the rogue agent finds himself landing with unnerving precariousness on a nearby scaffold tower. Bond, fueled by sheer determination, firmly pulls at the tightly wound rope encircling his leg. He begins a resolute climb upward, reaching out for a gun that is strategically positioned on the scaffold, even as he simultaneously attempts to retrieve the one lying on the ground below. Both men manage to pick up their respective weapons, with Bond firing his shot with impeccable precision and accuracy. Meanwhile, the bustling crowds in the busy Town Square are quickly dispersing in all directions as a police car navigates its way down the crowded street with caution. Covered in a fine layer of dust, Bond strides with purpose through the throngs of people, making his way towards the wooden gate that leads into the tunnel. Blood stains are noticeably visible on the cellar floor, yet the prisoner, Mr. White, cannot be found anywhere. Bond stares at the scene with a detached and unreadable expression. Outside, as steady rain falls, a sleek black Range Rover arrives in front of a towering high-rise block of flats. M stands pensively, gazing out from one of the balconies. Bond exits from the Range Rover and enters the building through its pristine glass door. He pays no heed to the stolid guard who stands watch, moving past him to enter a specific flat, where he encounters masked forensics officers and then joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M, graciously allowing her to enter. Meanwhile, Bond's eyes are narrowed as he sits in the back of a taxi, now wearing shades, as it drives down a dusty street. He steps out of the taxi right opposite the faded sign marking the entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Clad in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he makes his way into the building through the drab-tiled lobby, which is festooned with washing lines. Traversing the plain concrete corridors, he arrives at a particular door and positions himself strategically to one side of it. With meticulous care, he uses a tool to pick the lock, entering cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door quietly behind him, he ventures further into the apartment, when unexpectedly, a switch-blade flicks open. A man suddenly leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly and with malicious intent. Bond reacts with swiftness, slamming the attacker through the glass into the adjoining bedroom. The assailant quickly recovers and swings again, but Bond counters with a phone. The man goes down, reaching for a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, suffers a head-butt, then retaliates by hitting the attacker with a book. He skillfully parries the knife blows and seizes the man's knife-wielding hand in a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window out onto the balcony, where Bond, with calculated force, grips his opponent by the throat and drives the scissors into the man's neck and thigh. Bond remains completely unmoved as the man's eyes roll in agony before he dies, blood pooling beneath his head. Unfazed, Bond proceeds to search the room, retrieving a shirt from a wardrobe and tearing it to fashion a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs into the shirt and wipes blood from his nose with an almost casual air. Sparing only a brief glance at the now lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He then turns to the young black woman at reception, his demeanor grim and determined.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the gantry begins to rotate, it gradually shifts Bond away from the gun while simultaneously pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. Mitchell lands with a thud on a scaffold tower, and Bond quickly tugs at the rope that is tightly wound around his leg. With determination, he starts to climb towards a gun that is perched on the scaffold, while Bond, with equal urgency, attempts to reach the gun lying on the ground. Both men manage to scoop up their respective weapons, and Bond swiftly fires. Meanwhile, in the Town Square, the crowds begin to disperse as a police car slowly navigates its way down the congested street. Covered in a layer of dust, Bond strides purposefully through the thinning crowds, making his way towards a wooden gate that leads into a tunnel. Inside, the cellar floor is stained with blood, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is nowhere to be found. Bond stares at the scene with a dispassionate expression. Outside, rain begins to fall as a black Range Rover arrives at a towering block of flats. M stands on one of the balconies, gazing out. Bond emerges from the Range Rover, strides confidently through the building's glass door, and, without acknowledging the stolid guard, enters a flat. He passes by masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony. A boffin opens a door for M, and Bond's eyes narrow as he now sits in the back of a taxi, wearing shades, driving down a dusty street. He exits the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Dressed in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and navigates through the drab-tiled lobby, which is strung with washing lines. He moves down the plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself strategically to one side of it. Using a tool, he deftly picks the lock and cautiously enters, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. After closing the door behind him, he walks further into the apartment when suddenly, a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond reacts quickly, slamming the man through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings the blade again, but Bond counters by attacking with a phone. The man goes down and scrambles to find a pair of scissors. Bond seizes the opportunity to slam him into a wall, but the man retaliates with a head-butt. Bond responds by hitting him with a book, parrying the knife blows, and then grabbing the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. Their struggle takes them through a window and out onto a balcony. Bond grips the man by the throat and drives the scissors into his neck and thigh. Unmoved by the violence, Bond watches as the man's eyes roll in agony before he dies, blood pooling beneath his head. Bond then methodically searches the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and tearing it to fashion a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on the shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. With a grim demeanor, he turns to the young black woman at reception.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The gantry shifts, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold, where he lands on a tower. As Bond frees himself from the rope, both men scramble for their weapons, and Bond fires. Amidst the dispersing crowds in the Town Square, Bond, covered in dust, strides toward a wooden gate in the tunnel. Inside, he finds blood stains on the cellar floor, but Mr. White, the prisoner, is gone. Bond observes the scene dispassionately. 

In the rain, a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise block of flats, where M stands on a balcony. Bond exits the vehicle, enters the building, and passes a stolid guard and masked forensics officers to join M on the balcony. Later, Bond, now wearing shades, rides in the back of a taxi down a dusty street. He exits opposite the Hotel Dessalines, enters the building, and navigates through the drab-tiled lobby and plain corridors. Reaching a door, he picks the lock and cautiously enters the empty living room. 

Suddenly, a man with a switchblade leaps through glass doors. Bond slams him into the bedroom, and as the man recovers, Bond counters with a phone and a book, eventually subduing him with a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window onto a balcony, where Bond fatally stabs the man with scissors. Unmoved, Bond searches the rooms, using a ripped shirt as a bandage for his arm and wiping blood from his nose. He takes the door keys, barely glances at the body, and heads downstairs, turning to the young woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The gantry turns, a pivotal mechanism in industrial settings used for lifting and moving heavy objects, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower, a temporary structure often used in construction for support, as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground, a typical Walther PPK, which Bond often carries for its compact size and reliability. Both scoop up the weapons, and Bond fires, his shot echoing through the large, open space. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square, a typical gathering place in many European cities often surrounded by historic architecture, as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel, an old passageway likely used for centuries. Blood stains the cellar floor, creating a grim reminder of the violent confrontation, but the prisoner, Mr. White, a notorious figure in the criminal world, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene, his experience with such violence dulling his reaction. It's raining when a black Range Rover, a popular choice for its luxury and performance, arrives at a high-rise block of flats, a modern apartment complex. M stands looking out from one of the balconies, contemplating the situation below. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door, its modern design contrasting with the dreariness outside. Ignoring a stolid guard, trained to remain impassive, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, who meticulously search for every clue, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin, an expert in their field possibly dealing with technology, opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi, driving down a dusty street, typical of many remote or developing areas. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines, a modest accommodation probably named after the Haitian revolutionary leader, Jean-Jacques Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, Bond enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines, indicating its use by long-term or low-income residents. He moves down plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it, ensuring he's ready for any surprises. He uses a tool to pick the lock, a skill honed from years of espionage, and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room, which suggests sparse or transient habitation. Closing the door behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open, a weapon often associated with rapid, close-quarters attacks. A man, possibly another agent or a criminal, leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom, using the impact to disorient him. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone, improvising with whatever is at hand. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors, a common tool that becomes a weapon in desperate situations. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book, demonstrating his adaptability and resourcefulness. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold, a technique likely learned through advanced combat training. They go through a window out onto a balcony, the fragile barrier between safety and a precipitous drop. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh, a brutal but necessary act of self-defense. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head, a stark testament to the lethal world of espionage. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm, demonstrating his quick thinking and ability to use whatever's available. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose, maintaining his composure. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception, likely familiar with the risks of her environment, with a grim demeanor, signifying the gravity of the situation they've just faced.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The gantry turns moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor but the prisoner Mr White is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. It is raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a highrise block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard. Bond enters a flat passes masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers he enters the building and makes his way through the drabtiled lobby strung with washing lines. He moves down plain concrete corridors arrives at a door and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously peering around the door into the plainly furnished empty living room. Closing the door behind him he walks into the apartment when a switchblade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again but Bond attacks with the phone. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall gets headbutted then hits him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a fingerbreaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony then dies blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor but the prisoner Mr White is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. It is raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a highrise block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard. Bond enters a flat passes masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The crane turns, moving the cat away from the gun and pulling the dog off the scaffold. The rogue squirrel lands on a scaffold tower, as the cat pulls at the rope around his leg. The bird climbs for a gun on the scaffold while the cat tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons, and the cat fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a chicken makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, the cat strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. Blue, is gone. The cat stares dispassionately at the scene. It's raining when a red Range Rover arrives at a high-rise block of flats. A giraffe stands looking out from one of the balconies. The cat emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid elephant, the cat enters a flat, passes masked zebra officers, and joins the giraffe on the balcony. The frog opens a door for the giraffe. The cat's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi, driving down a dusty street. The cat gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, the cat enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines. The cat moves down plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it. The cat uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door behind him, the cat walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open. A rabbit leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. The cat slams the rabbit through the glass into the bedroom. The rabbit recovers and swings again, but the cat attacks with the phone. The rabbit goes down and finds a pair of scissors. The cat slams the rabbit into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits the rabbit with a book. The cat parries the knife blows and grabs the rabbit's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. The cat has the rabbit by the throat and drives the scissors into the rabbit's neck and thigh. The cat's completely unmoved as the rabbit rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath the rabbit's head. The cat goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. The cat shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the rabbit, the cat grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. The cat turns to the young black cat at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The gantry turns, moving Bond away from the slingshot and pulling Mitchell off the seesaw. The rogue agent lands on a seesaw tower, as Bond pulls at the belt around his leg. He climbs for a slingshot on the seesaw while Bond tries to reach the one on the grass. Both scoop up the weapons, and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Stadium as an ambulance makes its way down a crowded avenue. Covered in paint, Bond strides through the crowds towards the wicker gate in the overpass. Paint stains the shed floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. It's snowing when a black motorcycle arrives at a skyscraper block of offices. M stands looking out from one of the terraces. Bond emerges from the motorcycle and enters through the building's wooden door. Ignoring a stolid guard, Bond enters an office, passes masked forensic officers, and joins M on the terrace. The boffin opens a window for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing goggles in the back of a truck, driving down a sandy road. He gets out of the truck opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Cafe Dessalines. In a dark hoodie and light shorts, he enters the building and makes his way through the tiled gallery, strung with fairy lights. He moves down plain wooden hallways, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a key to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty kitchen. Closing the door behind him, he walks into the office when a rubber band flicks open. A man leaps through wooden doors, swinging the band wildly. Bond slams him through the wood into the attic. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the radio. He goes down and finds a pair of pliers. Bond slams him into a chair, gets head-butted, then hits him with a magazine. He parries the band blows and grabs the guy's band hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a curtain out onto a porch. Bond has him by the collar and drives the pliers into the guy's arm and ankle. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, water pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms, taking a jacket from a suitcase and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his leg. He shrugs on a jacket and wipes water from his chin. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the car keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at the counter with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The gantry rotates, shifting Bond away from the gun and nudging Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent bounces onto a scaffold tower, as Bond tugs at the cord around his leg. He skips for a gun on the scaffold while Bond struggles to retrieve the one on the ground. Both gather up the weapons, and Bond hurls it. The crowds are scattering in the Town Square as a police car inches its way down a bustling street. Covered in dust, Bond marches through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood splatters the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is absent. Bond gazes indifferently at the scene. It's drizzling when a black Range Rover slides to a halt at a high-rise block of flats. M stands observing from one of the balconies. Bond exits the Range Rover and slips through the building's glass door. Passing by a motionless guard, Bond steps into a flat, bypasses masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin pushes a door for M. Bond's eyes squint as he is now donning shades in the rear of a taxi, gliding down a dusty street. He climbs out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and maneuvers through the drab-tiled lobby, adorned with washing lines. He drifts down plain concrete corridors, reaches a door, and situates himself to one side of it. He utilizes a tool to jolt the lock and enters tentatively, glancing around the door into the plainly furnished, vacant living room. Sealing the door behind him, he steps into the apartment when a switch-blade snaps open. A man crashes through glass doors, flailing the blade wildly. Bond propels him through the glass into the bedroom. The man stabilizes and swings again, but Bond retaliates with the phone. He collapses and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then strikes him with a book. He deflects the knife attacks and grips the guy's knife hand in a finger-contorting hold. They burst through a window out onto a balcony. Bond grips him by the throat and guides the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond remains completely indifferent as the guy rolls his eyes in anguish, then expires, blood pooling beneath his head. He proceeds to explore the rooms, lifting a shirt from a wardrobe and tearing it to fashion a bandage for a cut on his arm. He slips on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely acknowledging the body, he snatches the door keys and descends the stairs. He pivots to the young black woman at reception with a stern demeanor.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The crane swivels, shifting the lamppost away from the piano and pulling the sandwich off the ladder. The mischievous puppet lands on a bookshelf, as the lamppost tugs at the string around its ankle. It climbs for a violin on the bookshelf while the lamppost tries to reach the one on the carpet. Both gather up the musical instruments, and the lamppost plays. The flowers are scattering in the Village Circle as a fire truck makes its way down a crowded avenue. Covered in glitter, the lamppost strides through the flowers towards the metal bridge in the archway. Paint stains the garage floor, but the gardener, Mr. Blue, is missing. The lamppost stares indifferently at the display. It's snowing when a red tractor arrives at a low-rise row of houses. A balloon stands gazing out from one of the porches. The lamppost emerges from the tractor and enters through the building's wooden gate. Ignoring a bored guard dog, the lamppost enters a cabin, passes masked sculptors, and joins the balloon on the porch. A scientist opens a window for the balloon. The lamppost's eyes narrow as it is now wearing gloves in the back of a skateboard, rolling down a muddy alley. It gets off the skateboard opposite the bright sign and gateway to the Cinema Limerick. In a striped hoodie and dark shorts, it enters the house and makes its way through the colorful-carpeted foyer, lined with fishing nets. It moves down narrow wooden corridors, arrives at a window, and positions itself to one side of it. It uses a gadget to open the bolt and enters cautiously, peering around the window into the messily decorated, vacant den. Sealing the window behind it, it walks into the cottage when a pocket-watch snaps shut. A dragon leaps through wooden doors, swinging the pocket-watch wildly. The lamppost slams it through the wood into the attic. The dragon recovers and swings again, but the lamppost attacks with the calculator. It goes down and finds a fork. The lamppost slams it into a shelf, gets head-butted, then hits it with a guitar. It deflects the watch swings and grabs the creature's watch hand in a toe-breaking grip. They go through an archway out onto a terrace. The lamppost has it by the collar and drives the fork into the creature's elbow and shin. The lamppost's entirely unfazed as the creature rolls its eyes in agony, then expires, ink pooling beneath its snout. It goes to explore the closets, taking a hat from a drawer and tearing it to make a bandage for a scratch on its leg. It shrugs on a vest and wipes ink from its chin. Barely glancing at the creature, it grabs the window latches and heads upstairs. It turns to the young green cat at check-in with a stern expression.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The escalator rotates, shifting Marlow away from the briefcase and pushing Jackson off the ladder. The undercover detective descends onto a ladder platform, as Marlow tugs at the belt around his ankle. He crawls for a briefcase on the ladder while Marlow attempts to reach the one on the floor. Both grasp the briefcases, and Marlow throws one. The spectators are scattering in the Central Plaza as an ambulance corners down a bustling avenue. Laden in dirt, Marlow saunters through the spectators towards the metal gate in the alleyway. Red stains the basement floor, but the detainee, Mr. Gray, is gone. Marlow gazes indifferently at the spectacle. It's drizzling when a silver Mercedes arrives at a towering apartment complex. R observes from one of the terraces. Marlow exits the Mercedes and strides through the building's revolving entrance. Overlooking a stern usher, Marlow enters an apartment, bypasses veiled pathology experts, and meets R on the terrace. The technician unveils a panel for R. Marlow's gaze sharpens as he is now wearing goggles in the rear seat of a limousine, navigating down a gritty boulevard. He steps out of the limousine opposite the weathered sign and portal to the Hotel Lafayette. In a dark jacket and beige slacks, he accesses the building and strides through the dingy-tiled entrance, crisscrossed with clotheslines. He wanders down austere cement corridors, reaches a portal, and places himself to one flank of it. He uses a gadget to unlock the portal and proceeds carefully, peeking around the portal into the plainly adorned, vacant parlor. Closing the portal behind him, he ventures into the apartment when a retractable knife clicks open. An individual crashes through glass panels, brandishing the knife erratically. Marlow hurls him through the glass into the chamber. The individual regains balance and thrusts again, but Marlow counters with the lamp. He collapses and acquires a pair of pliers. Marlow hurls him into a partition, gets elbowed, then strikes him with a journal. He deflects the knife slashes and snatches the fellow's knife hand in a bone-crushing grip. They crash through a window onto a terrace. Marlow grips him by the collar and drives the pliers into the fellow's shoulder and calf. Marlow remains unfazed as the fellow rolls his eyes in suffering, then expires, crimson pooling beneath his skull. He proceeds to scour the quarters, taking a jacket from a closet and tearing it to fashion a bandage for a scrape on his shoulder. He slips on a jacket and dabs crimson from his chin. Hardly looking at the cadaver, he snatches the portal keys and descends the stairs. He nods to the young Asian man at the desk with a stern expression.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The crane swivels, relocating Bond away from the umbrella and nudging Mitchell off the ladder. The rogue agent topples onto a ladder structure, as Bond tugs at the belt around his ankle. He scrambles for a bat on the ladder while Bond attempts to grasp the one on the ground. Both snatch up the tools, and Bond hurls. The crowds are dissolving in the Town Square as a fire truck maneuvers its way down a bustling avenue. Covered in cobwebs, Bond strides through the crowds towards the metal door in the tunnel. Ink stains the cellar floor, but the visitor, Mr. White, is gone. Bond glances indifferently at the scene. It's snowing when a red Jeep arrives at a towering office complex. M stands peering out from one of the terraces. Bond emerges from the Jeep and steps through the building's revolving entry. Disregarding a stoic butler, Bond enters a unit, passes cloaked surveillance agents, and joins M on the terrace. The technician slides a panel for M. Bond's gaze narrows as he is now wearing glasses in the back of a rickshaw, cruising down a gritty alley. He alights from the rickshaw opposite the worn emblem and entry to the Motel Dessalines. In a dark sweater and khaki shorts, he steps into the structure and navigates through the bland-tiled foyer, festooned with string lights. He advances down unadorned stone corridors, reaches a gate, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a pen to undo the latch and enters cautiously, glancing around the gate into the sparsely decorated, vacant dining room. Shutting the gate behind him, he walks into the apartment when a flashlight clicks on. A man vaults through wooden doors, swinging the flashlight erratically. Bond propels him through the wood into the kitchen. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond counters with the remote. He crouches and finds a tennis racket. Bond propels him into a cabinet, gets shoved, then strikes him with a clipboard. He deflects the jabs and grips the guy's hand in a joint-twisting hold. They tumble through a curtain out onto a patio. Bond has him by the collar and drives the racket into the guy's shoulder and arm. Bond remains unfazed as the guy's eyes go wide in torment, then succumbs, ink pooling beneath his feet. He proceeds to rummage through the spaces, grabbing a jacket from a closet and tearing it to fashion a bandage for a scratch on his hand. He dons a jacket and wipes ink from his lips. Barely acknowledging the figure, he grabs the ladder keys and moves downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at the concierge with a stern expression.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The platform spins, whisking the musician away from the sculpture and dragging the artist off the podium. The rogue chef crashes onto a ladder tower, as the musician tugs at the string around his arm. He ascends for a book on the ladder while the musician attempts to reach the one on the floor. Both snatch up the novels, and the musician whispers. The gatherings are scattering in the Market Plaza as a fire truck makes its way down a bustling avenue. Covered in paint, the musician glides through the gatherings towards the metal gate in the alley. Ink stains the attic ceiling, but the guest, Mr. Blue, is missing. The musician gazes indifferently at the situation. It's snowing when a red van halts at an apartment block of offices. A stands peering out from one of the terraces. The musician exits from the van and strolls through the building's wooden entryway. Disregarding a grumpy butler, the musician enters an office, passes hooded sanitation workers, and meets A on the terrace. The engineer closes a window for A. The musician's eyes squint as he is now wearing gloves in the back of a yacht, floating down an icy river. He steps off the yacht opposite the bright billboard and gateway to the Library Bellamore. In a bright jacket and dark jeans, he steps inside the structure and makes his way through the opulent-tiled atrium, hung with banners. He maneuvers down elegant marble hallways, arrives at an archway, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a device to unlock the gate and enters stealthily, glancing around the arch into the lavishly decorated, unoccupied dining room. Closing the archway behind him, he ambles into the restaurant when a corkscrew twists open. A woman vaults through velvet curtains, swinging the corkscrew wildly. The musician throws her through the curtains into the cellar. The woman regains balance and swings again, but the musician counters with the candle. She collapses and finds a fork. The musician smashes her into a pillar, gets shoved, then strikes her with a map. He deflects the corkscrew thrusts and grips the woman's corkscrew arm in a wrist-twisting clutch. They tumble through a gate out onto a terrace. The musician has her by the collar and drives the fork into the woman's collar and waist. The musician's completely unperturbed as the woman rolls her eyes in discomfort, then slumbers, ink pooling beneath her neck. He proceeds to search the chambers, taking a jacket from a closet and tearing it to fashion a sling for a mark on his hand. He throws on a jacket and cleans ink from his cheek. Barely noticing the figure, he grabs the window latches and heads upstairs. He turns to the elderly white boy at information with a cheerless expression.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bond finds himself in a tense confrontation with the rogue agent Mitchell, both scrambling for their guns amidst a scaffold tower. After neutralizing the threat, Bond navigates through a dispersing crowd in the Town Square, noticing Mr. Whiteâ€™s disappearance from a blood-stained cellar. Amidst rain, Bond arrives at a high-rise to meet M, bypassing security to stand with her on a balcony. Soon after, he discreetly travels to the Hotel Dessalines, maneuvering through its unremarkable corridors until he confronts a man wielding a switchblade. A brutal fight ensues, leading Bond to kill the attacker with scissors. Unfazed, Bond tends to his wounds, searches the apartment, and exits, leaving behind the grim scene. He moves past a young woman at reception, maintaining a stoic demeanor.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor Barely glancing at the body he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs  He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose  He goes to search the rooms taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm  Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony then dies blood pooling beneath his head  Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh  They go through a window out onto a balcony  He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a fingerbreaking hold  Bond slams him into a wall gets headbutted then hits him with a book  He goes down and finds a pair of scissors  The man recovers and swings again but Bond attacks with the phone  Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom  A man leaps through glass doors swinging the blade wildly  Closing the door behind him he walks into the apartment when a switchblade flicks open  He uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously peering around the door into the plainly furnished empty living room  He moves down plain concrete corridors arrives at a door and positions himself to one side of it  In a dark polo shirt and light trousers he enters the building and makes his way through the drabtiled lobby strung with washing lines  He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines  Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi driving down a dusty street  The boffin opens a door for M  Bond enters a flat passes masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony  Ignoring a stolid guard  Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door  M stands looking out from one of the balconies  It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a highrise block of flats  Bond stares dispassionately at the scene  Blood stains the cellar floor but the prisoner Mr White is gone  Covered in dust Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel  The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street  Both scoop up the weapons and Bond fires  He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground  The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg  The gantry turns moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold
